lines.text: How delightful. How are you and who are you?
Marcia Brooks, Morning Gazette
Oh reporter. Hmm.
[clucks tongue]
So charming, too. Well Miss Brooks, I think the buildings in New York are very beautiful and the women are very tall. There you are my dear. You have your interview. Now I trust you'll excuse me.

[In the dress salon]
What are you doin' here?

[Flustered]
Uh, buyin' a dress for my aunt in Hoboken.
Why, Mr. Lefty, the newspapers said you were incarcerated.
You know I never drink. I was pinched, but I beat the rap through a suspended sentence.

[On board ship]
Hey, we came here to meet your brother. You remember?
Oh, yes, yes.
And I sure hope he ain't got dames for a hobby like you have.
I'm afraid you're in for a disappointment, Lefty.

[Referring to the Falcon]
Bates, follow 'em.
Why, Chief?
Because they told me I could be the boss, and the boss always gives the orders. You don't mind, do yuh?
No, not at all, Chief.
[Donovan pulls him into the car by the collar]

[authoritatively]
I'm handling this case!
What a break for crime!
Well, small world, isn't it?
Yeah, and there are some very small people in it!
Can't we get loose?
I'm afraid we're tied with typical German efficiency.
He's almost as bad as his brother, only worse.
Lieutenant, you got nothing on me. My being here was strictly co-accidental.
ladies without escorts are not admitted to the Rose Room.
Who said I was a lady?
Well, small world, isn't it?
Yes; and there's some very small people in it.
